title: A Shot in the Mouth (US) (1990)

Plot:

The Pink Pussy is missing and needs to be found. A large diamond has gone missing and it's up to the the inspector with a bad accent to infiltrate a convent in an attempt to find the thief who took the Pink Pussy! He finds more than just the Pink Pussy he was looking for!


In this satire on the Pink Panther movies, we are treated to a battle of the accents. The clear winner is Tom Byronâ€™s Scottish Burr-r-r. Randy Spearsâ€™ broad French accent, a la Clouseau, is sometimes so thick as to be unintelligible. But I like the change from Kato to K-Y. Cute. Director Fox doesnâ€™t overdo any of the action scenes which too often these days are drawn out to the detriment of any story development. Thus we have many comedy bits in line with our plot which has a lady jewel thief hiding out in a convent. Lauren Brice is a superior Mother Superior and Kim Alexis can hear my confession any time. Some erotic sequences make for solid viewing
